programmes.show_description: The Trojan Bus: Classic 1970s police drama series. Regan and Carter investigate an art deal that is more than it seems and ends up with a waste ground shoot-out.
Why Pay Tax?: Comedy-drama series about the shady dealings of a loveable rogue and his reluctant sidekick. Terry loses his heart when Barry the Bookie loses his money.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
This programme brings you up to date with the latest action from the world of motorsport and features race coverage, insights, and behind-the-scenes footage from the best series.
Shopping from home.
From Nijinsky to Tiger Roll, Ed Chamberlin introduces some of the great racehorses of the modern era - enjoy Best Mate's third Gold Cup and Shergar racing to Derby glory.
Brian Moore and Jim Rosenthal present football highlights from January 1981 as Merseyside rivals Everton and Liverpool meet at Goodison Park in the fourth round of the FA Cup.
Brian Moore and Jim Rosenthal present football highlights from February 1981 on FA Cup Fifth Round day that include Nottingham Forest v Bristol City and Southampton v Everton.
Little Games: Classic US action drama series. Thomas falls for an attractive security expert hired to help protect Robin's Nest during a jewellery exhibit worth millions of dollars.
The Nicest Guys on the Block: Classic US detective drama. One of Theo's colleagues discovers that an old school friend is involved with fencing the loot from a diamond heist.
The Relief of Matty King: Classic drama. Ken is hired by a nightclub owner to find out why he cannot renew a gaming licence, and a has-been comedian gets into trouble at Woodcote Park.
The Trojan Bus: Classic 1970s police drama series. Regan and Carter investigate an art deal that is more than it seems, and ends up in a wasteground shootout.
Blind Eye: Classic detective series. Dempsey and Makepeace uncover a plot to murder Spikings while on an investigation to find a police informant's son who has been kidnapped.
Professor Jonathan Higgins: Classic US action drama series. Agatha hires Thomas to find out who took money from her ladies' club, and Higgins tries to refine a distant cousin of his.
No Immunity for Murder: Classic US detective drama. Theo is convinced that the suspects in the murder of a book-keeper are innocent, but his attempts to prove it cause conflict.
Vallance's Liberty: Classic drama. Harry enlists Ken's help when an Austria-themed night at the Woodcote is used as a cover by a gang of criminals on the trail of hidden plans.
Southwell: Megan Nicholls presents racing from Southwell as it stages Round Two of the 2026 Friday Night Live series and National Hunt star Constitution Hill makes its Flat debut.
Kings of the Canvas: Richard Henwood takes a look back at the glory days of British wrestling with some classic action from the archives.
Monster Storm Over Atigun: Nail-biting documentary series. The drivers are forced to call on all their experience when they are hit by a devastating storm in the Atigun Pass.
Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Toni Storm, MJF, Ricochet and Adam Page.
The Brawl for All: Wrestling documentary series. The Brawl for All was a legitimate boxing tournament that led to career-ending injuries and had audiences begging for the final bell.
Poppy: Violent criminal Vic Labbett returns to England to recover the proceeds of an earlier robbery, and Regan and Carter must stop him before he can get his hands on the loot.
The Birdman of Wormwood Scrubs: Drama series about the shady dealings of a loveable rogue. Ex-con Ernie leaves prison after 14 years with 250,000 pounds stashed away in a bank.
Shopping from home.
The latest news and reviews from the world of cars.
Shopping from home.
Brian Moore and Jim Rosenthal present football highlights from October 1980 including West Ham United v Bolton Wanderers at Upton Park and Sheffield Wednesday v Leyton Orient.
The Birdman of Wormwood Scrubs: Drama series about the shady dealings of a loveable rogue. Ex-con Ernie leaves prison after 14 years with 250,000 pounds stashed away in a bank.
Stay Lucky, Eh?: Classic '70s police drama series. Regan and Carter are on the case when a pair of robbers are themselves robbed at gunpoint.
Oli Bell and the team are at Kempton ahead of another competitive day of racing just ahead of the 2026 Cheltenham Festival.
Brian Moore introduces football highlights from October 1971 that include West Ham United against Leicester City and Huddersfield Town against Manchester United.
Knuckleheads: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz inspect a racing driver's collection of motoring memorabilia and gamble on buying some vintage pilots' equipment.
Bombay Sapphire and Ghillie Kettle: Join us at the Bombay Sapphire distillery to learn how this classic British gin is flavoured, then discover the ingenuity of the Ghillie Kettle.
Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of racing from Kempton, Southwell and Newcastle - the feature meeting is at Kempton and includes novice races and the very competitive Coral Trophy.
Mutiny: Drama series about CS Forester's famous seafaring hero. Hornblower sets sail aboard HMS Renown on a dangerous mission where events soon force the contemplation of mutiny.
Bond film starring George Lazenby and Telly Savalas, 1969. 007 encounters Blofeld once more as the villain plans to unleash a plague through brainwashed 'angels of death'.
Latest news from the world of entertainment.
Bond film starring George Lazenby and Telly Savalas, 1969. 007 encounters Blofeld once more as the villain plans to unleash a plague through brainwashed 'angels of death'.
Action from the day's games across the Football League including Hull City v Queens Park Rangers, Stoke City v Leicester City and Wrexham v Ipswich Town in the Championship.
Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Toni Storm, MJF, Ricochet and Adam Page.
